intro: Pyramidanthe rufa var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved red pyramidanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of red, tubular flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
